SEZG8GEx23bV6H11SOwL4A.text: Best pizza and no doubt....wings in town. Great service and staff. A must visit. If you live in town or are visiting the queen city, check them out.

FCQIhMPtDVTIDwWm6391Bg.text: Legit Buffalo style pizza. Everything was on point with the pizza. Buffalo style is a slightly thicker dough than any NYC style but not quite like Chicago style. Right at that sweet spot in the middle. Their wings are also excellent and between both of those, I felt like I was eating back in Buffalo. Chicken Finger sub is also very good and another Buffalo tradition you should try.

qWqM6K5cbDJBmesS2lyL0w.text: First time last night. Bourbon wings, Italian sandwich, and Greek salad were all very very good. We will be back!

H_ioq3gQIpgdN48oJxUKlw.text: Great pizza and wings! I'm a Buffalo native and have driven to the Matthews location a few times to get my fix of Buffalo style pizza.  First trip to the Uptown location was not a disappointment.    Spoke with owner Jimmy N and reminiscing about home was fun, but its the food that will bring me back soon. Great location for the Knights games.  I recommend parking down the street, eating at Bisonte and walking over to the game.  BTW, we've tried that same routine three times with Mellow Mushroom and were late because of slow service every time.    The Bisonte classic pizza with pepperoni features crispy, thicker slices of pepperoni that are so much better than the typical used everywhere else.  Try it!

mglCbTPLJZwUxdlIvZSmvQ.text: I knew this place from it's Matthews location. The Charlotte location even tops that for a great slice of pizza.

V4jOa1bobaT9sY7Y-Gte7A.text: Great Buffalo style pizza! Exactly what we need here. Ordered the pepperoni pizza and it was just like how I remember in Western NY. Will definitely be returning soon.

XO-kszz61WkT9nPMaJ0N3A.text: I was craving wings and pizza one day and I found them on yelp. I sat at the bar and was waited on by the bartender Lucky. He was super friendly and gave me lots of suggestions. I ordered the famous honey bbq and they were amazinggggg! Perfect amount of crispness. I also ordered a slice of cheese pizza (I'm kinda picky and I only eat cheese), but it was just okay. I would probably only come here for the wings, but I'm sure the other pizzas are good just looking form the pictures.

ldUsBQtaHwmDZeWj__43HQ.text: Authentic Buffalo pizza and wings! I'm a Buffalo native so I was sooooo happy when I found out about Bisonte!

iv3FdzbS2M_4p3npAhxq_w.text: The absolute best New York pizza. We live in Connecticut and are staying 3 months in Charlotte and this is our favorite Friday night hang out. We love the NY style pepperoni pizza and the Carolina Gold wings are very flavorful. Can't say enough about the food and service. It's all been top notch. The owners are very friendly and always check in to chat and make sure everything is perfect. We will miss Bisonte when we heard back home at the end of March.

0ahors1EJruMsYC722zkoA.text: Exceptionally great restaurant. The openers go out of their way to make sure you feel welcomed and have an overall great experience. Have not been disappointed in good or service. The pizza logs are a must try if you are there and need to look into their stinger sub as well as any of their pizzas!

-XKtRFBsuR24XtjjRM7eOQ.text: Great staff and service! Fun place with good pizza and yes the homemade blue cheese and ranch dips are out of this world.

-LBlAf-Ys0KXNUCsErix5A.text: A guy I work with is a Buffalo native and had already gone a few times since it opened, so three of us decided to check it out for lunch.  I got the 12" Stinger with Hot and BBQ sauce.  A Buffalo staple, toasted sub with chicken fingers tossed in your choice of sauce, steak, and cheese .  I was going to get the 6" and fries but changed my mind and just got the 12" and it was almost to much food by itself.  Overall very pleased with the food.  I thought it was a little pricey but food seemed worth the little extra in price.  I will be coming back to try the Beef on Weck and of course the "Buffalo" style Pizza and Wings.  You can't go wrong with the Stinger but you better be hungry and have a place to take a nap in the afternoon.

ibjsa85Rt_wjEjcIUJ-pOQ.text: Being a Native Buffalonian, this place is the real deal. The curl up pepperoni and sauce make the Buffalo style pizza. The subs are great as well; not to mention the Wings. Never had anything I didn't love and great service to boot!

KqYiAwsmS95WT3cHpGFscQ.text: Awesome pizza place!  We came here after seeing the reviews and were not disappointed. Staff was knowledgeable and friendly.  Would recommend!  Will come back

GiB-j3BuRuZWv9kpNjemXA.text: I was so excited to see a pizza place coming to third ward and I have not been disappointed. Since it's opened, I've ordered from there three times already because I can't get enough of the buffalo style pizza! We've also ordered their wings and thought they were great--came out exactly as we wanted them (extra crispy). I've never had any issues with the service and everyone seems super friendly. Love that they stay open a little later on the weekends and would love to see some later nights during the week for that inevitable late night snack craving!

8m6MivMM7z40d2M6gHUDUQ.text: We started with the pizza rolls, now I am craving them! Came with a delicious homemade marinara with a touch of sweet.Had a Greek Salad and the dressing was homemade for sure, super yum! Probably one of the best salads I have had in a while. My boyfriend loved his pizza! They carry Pepsi products which is meh! The staff was friendly and upbeat! They did a great job designing the place, but our table was wobbly. Super annoying when you try to enjoy your company and food! We will definitely be back to try more on the menu!

3bhipa1ec2motvnPFIVWDQ.text: Came here for lunch with a large group of coworkers (12 or so) and we all ordered wings. Both the songs and the service were excellent. Would highly recommend!

TljGvH-w0K6dxHWsxTDBlg.text: Wings are awesome!! VERY nice restaurant and atmosphere. Can't wait to go back soon and try the pizza! Customer service was excellent as well.

uYI04yGH4CYDwBM3vYjMQQ.text: This place is horrible .. sauce is like water and the service is pathetic . Took 40 min to serve 2 slices and the restaurant was at 25% capacity. They have no idea what they're doing.

JA1fG2q2MKNQjgtmyVUgmw.text: By far the best pizza in Charlotte. Nothing I've had around the area even compares.  Crust is light and fluffy and the pepperoni is great. Definitely the go to place for pizza.

XzyDjMLxSbtFUotf_ohSLg.text: This is my favorite pizza place in Charlotte. The restaurant is large so we never have to wait for a table. Their buffalo chicken pizza is INCREDIBLE. The best thing on the menu by far. I always take my out-of-town guests here and also often order carry-out. Would absolutely recommend to others.

YMMdfrSLV3anesdgWQ2HeA.text: My neighborhood spot. Great service, bartenders are knowledgeable and location is casual and chill.  Wings were great..try out the bourbon wings. Pixxa, I've tried 2 seperate times, it is subpar. Wings, beer and chill.

mae484fx6dI_i2HDdBkqfQ.text: I went to this place after my friend who is also from Buffalo went there and gave it great reviews. So I tried it tonight and was pleasantly surprised. I ordered the 6 mild wings and they were fried to perfection. The mild sauce is seriously mild so our waitress Gena brought me a lil medium and it was really good. Their blue cheese and ranch they make it themselves and it taste like Buffalo overall it was really good.

photos.caption: Photo of Bisonte Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. Medium wings and smoked wings
Photo of Bisonte Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Bisonte Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mild wings really good

--W8n1gOK_3BtGviieelJw.text: I had dinner here tonight I loved the atmosphere it was very posh not your usual pizza spot I ordered 12 wings and got them half medium and half sweet BBQ I liked both flavors they were really good wings I liked the homemade blue cheese i wasn't a fan of the fries however they were a lil bland and soggy our server was very kind tho and attentive they have Pepsi products which I don't like at all however the Pepsi I had wasn't bad

photos.caption: Photo of Bisonte Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States

BABdbS1R59stsVyE_UCSzA.text: The wings are some of the best I have had in Charlotte! We started with the wings then moved on to the pizza and split an stinger sub. The pizza was amazing you could tell that the ingredients were Freash and they didn't skimp on the quality of products. The steak sub has a special sauce which was amazing I would put it on just about anything.

EJNUq2MEVguvjMKAYOm7pQ.text: Just an awesome restaurant! You will not be disappointed! The pizza is amazing. I would also suggest ordering the chicken wings fried well done. You will truly enjoy your experience. The pricing is just right for an average family to have a well cooked affordable meal!

a_mZkITAARnUI-qH0V456w.text: Buffalo native, born and bred. Hands down best pizza in all of Charlotte. That's something I don't say lightly, as some pizza joints in buffalo are not my favorite. If you are looking for awesome pizza and wings!!!! Stop in, you will not be disappointed. I will make sure this place is a stop every time I am in town! Thanks so much and keep up the great work!

yrT8LlnruYY9v8yhNSntxQ.text: Their award winning wings are a must! The Wings are absolutely awesome!!!! Pizza is really good too, we tried the bizonte classic. Really nice personnel and great service.

DDy-ydlSMHS5a0gxCbZ2Cw.text: Stopped in for a late lunch and sat at the bar. The staff was slow to acknowledge me but like I said, it was late - lunch rush was over and folks were trying to clean up and get ready for dinner.  I ordered the two slice (pepperoni) special and an order of the mild wings... The pizza wasn't what I expected. I was thinking more New York style, thin and on the greasy side. This was a thicker with a bready, chewy crust. The sauce was definitely on the sweet side, tasted more of sugar than tomatoes. The pepperoni flavor was nice but it was these thick, nickel sized slices. Kinda weird.  The wings were nice but too expensive, $7 for six wings? They're f*cking chicken wings people, ridiculous to pay more than a buck per wing. Plus it would be nice if they had some non-Bufalo flavors - garlic,  bbw, etc.  Anyway... Chewy, sweet pizza. Pricey but tasty wings. Lackluster service. Had better and I've had worse but not a place I would go out of my way to visit again.

photos.caption: Photo of Bisonte Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States

U0xhXK34RxbwS738gdotUg.text: Went for lunch on a Friday at 12:20. We didn't get our food until 12:55 and the place was empty so we were a little confused as to why it took so long to get our food. So needless to say I didn't have a good opinion of the place by the time we got our food. That being said the food was pretty good. I got a slice of pizza and a small Greek salad. I would come back to give them another chance but when we finally paid and walked out it was 1:25 which is kind of ridiculous for a place that people come to for lunch.

M20qMsOCZsTgGLkasJv09Q.text: Best wings in the QC by far. Also, great True Buffalo food including the Stinger. A must try. Very good service ..the owner is usually there working hard and very nice guy who is originally from Buffalo

WnkjXC_pkKdVQrrlwAlPmg.text: As a Buffalo expat, Bisonte hits the spot everytime.  The pizza is delicious and the beef on weck sub transports you back home.  Highly recommend!

u8iji0AdNTZZlaKTjL285g.text: This place is AWESOME! Delicious pepperoni pizza and bbq wings. Fries were also really good- will definitely be back!!

l2hPZtIKPIF61TjBL49j5Q.text: This place is awful. First off, charging $20 for a pizza outside of uptown with one topping is robbery. Second, I requested an extra crispy pizza and when I showed up they said they burnt it too much and had to cook another one. The picture attached is what I got. An undercooked mess. I'll never go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Bisonte Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Bisonte Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States

igzT6xqlZqH0VffxJA-Gzw.text: Great place for pizza and wings. Their bourbon bbq flavor wings are amazing. You can tell they use good quality ingredients. Everything is fresh and homemade. You have to try their fried cheesecake. Customer service is great! Will come back again.

5LLg-d9-vxF3l6B1PZWYLQ.text: I've honestly never had "Buffalo Style" pizza before, even though I've been to Buffalo several times (I always eat wings or a good beef on weck when I'm in town). So I figured I'd give it a shot. I was very pleasantly surprised! We ordered takeout - a pizza for the family and some wings to see how they compared to wings in Buffalo.  The wings were great - meaty, plenty of buffalo sauce, and good homemade blue cheese. I didn't order the specialty wings, which I probably should have. These didn't really represent what I've eaten in Buffalo very well - more like what we in the South are accustomed to for "Buffalo" wings. But they were good nonetheless. Next time, I'll go for specialty wings, though.  The pizza was fantastic - a good departure from what we're used to in Charlotte, from the many  chains, NY style, Neapolitan style, and build-it-yourself pizza joints. We stuck with the basics - pepperoni and Italian sausage. The pepperonis were tiny, but plentiful and flavorful - the kind that curl up while baking (my favorite). I would prefer more finely crumbled Italian sausage, but it was still good. Next time, double pepperoni for me!  Now as far as the crust goes, I'm probably going to commit some sort of blasphemy to Western New Yorkers in my description (so forgive my lack of knowledge about Buffalo-style pizza). And by that, I'd say it's a cross between NYC-style and Chicago-style. The pizzas/slices are large like NYC style, but the crust has a certain fluffiness to it reminiscent of a less-deep Chicago-style deep dish. It kind of gave the best of both worlds. Normally, I wouldn't think this description would be all that appealing if I were reading it, but biting into a slice with that fluffy-in-the-middle, but crisp-on-the-outside crust was very nice in fact. Great flavors, great pizza - my wife and I both enjoyed it thoroughly, and it was nice to have a different type of pizza than we were used to.  I'll most certainly be back. I need to try those specialty wings, as well as give the beef on weck a shot, not to mention that this will be one of our new go-to spots for pizza!

jwFUSReRuCaWh0amw32u4w.text: This is a very sub par slice of pizza. The dough is soft and soggy, not helped by the amount of grease   The sauce is bland with way too much pepper trying to cover that up. This is very similar to little caesars but for about three times the price. There are much better options for pizza in Charlotte.

xz5P79aEYCFJeR28MF128w.text: I just tried Bisonte for the first time today and the Beef on Weck was delicious. Staff were very friendly. Overall good experience and I will definitely be back!  Thanks.

aUCD4KGPsjeER79cgtBnNw.text: OMG, delicious pizza. Some of the best I've had. However, those pizza logs are not good. Wontons and pizza ingredients are not a good mix. Also, be sure to have plenty of time when you order. Full pizzas are like 25-30 minutes to come out. Also, the charbroiled wings are hands down the best in Charlotte.

ruA5sRbLqVob3RVpywqctQ.text: Penne with Alfredo sauce was soooo good- portion was huge!! They also make the BEST blue cheese I have EVER had. Will definitely be back.

-bpaF9puenzqRTthPBF_3Q.text: Amazing wings!!!! Their charbroiled wings are to die for!!! Get the blue cheese!!! Its delicious!!! We had pizza, wings, boneless wings, chicken fingers, mozzarella sticks, and a chicken parmesan sandwich.  All were excellent. Staff was amazing even with a fire alarm going off in the building. They did everything to make sure we were well taken care of after the fire dept cleared the building. Our server was Anna, she was friendly, attentive and amazing!!!!

qq9f-fHXXhmIPNRlcAVNvQ.text: Great restaurant! True buffalo wings and pizza. New location is awesome. Food is great across the board. Owners and staff are super friendly. Highly recommend!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bisonte Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States

U5xmIWcSGu8mI5oEDST7gA.text: Okay so I lived in Buffalo for 10 years so I know something about the food. I have also visited Bisonte's original Matthew location several times and have stated that it's the only Buffalo food joint in the area that gets everything right. The same can be said for the uptown location except that the setup is much different and the menu is slightly smaller.  First, for dine-in, this location is waiter/waitress service unlike the counter service in Matthews. The uptown location used to be a different place (and probably more than one) and sits in the shadows of Johnson and Wales University. Uptown has a nicely decorated small bar and some local beers on tap and in bottles and cans. Don't worry Buffalo people, they have Labattt Blue too.   As I mentioned the menu is smaller; a couple of the subs and the eggplant Parmesan pasta are missing from uptown. Still, the food was good and tasted just like food at the the original one. The char-b-q wings from the pit were amazing. You probably figured it out from the other reviews that Buffalo style pizza is thicker and that is good too. They also have the thinner NY style if you prefer that.  I should also mention that our service was excellent and our orders were perfect. I would have liked to have had a few carrots and celery with the wings but that is not a huge deal.

-C27medKn-BAu44v9TU8Gw.text: This is my second time ordering from this restaurant through Doordash. Doordash is not the problem the restaurant is. When I first order the wings was okay, but what in the hell was those suppose to be hard as twisted garlic sticks. So I was having a hungry headache and decided to give the another try with different menu items... BIG MISTAKE... THIS PLACE JUST NASTY AND DONT KNOW HOW TO COOK AND GOOD TASTING QUALITY FOOD. I order the 6pc boneless wings that comes with fries. I ordered the 18 boneless wings with sweet bbq that is also suppose to come with fries. And I order garlic bread with mozzarella added. So 1st the garlic bread sandwich that had no garlic on it, but slapped a piece of mozzarella between the bread made me puke immediately. It was that bad. I didn't order a cheese sandwich. 2nd I never received my boneless wings, I received 18 flats and drummets with the bone inside. Wings was soggy and spicy, when I requested sweet bbq sauce. No fries came with my order and no celery like advertised on this company website through Doordash. Needless to say I have contacted Doordash in regards to the order being wrong. I will never eat here again. This place need to go get training from other real pizza  restaurants.

photos.caption: Photo of Bisonte Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burnt inedible Fries Anyone?  GROSS!!
Photo of Bisonte Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. Zero stars!! Look how burnt the fries and chicken is totally inedible. Chicken so hard hurt my teeth. Do not order from here!!!

Yp4QAGf5FQFU-ImnyUCx9g.text: Bisonte Pizza has a daily two-slice pizza special: cheese, pepperoni or some specialty pizza (classic is my favorite). I also like their spaghetti (with meat sauce or meatball). The staff knows me by name and is always very friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Bisonte Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States

eSSpfFfz4spzBqNKzNpMBg.text: Pizza was sub-par.  Super doughy, hardly cooked properly. Terrible value.  17" 3- topping pizza, delivered, $33.  Someone called this NY-style.  Hardly.  More like Domino's-style.

sumqGKsik_oXQ8b4lzjygg.text: As always, I only review when I've had an absolute good/bad situation.  Maybe it's the carry out that hasn't been mastered?  FIRST time we ordered an Antipasto salad(No Olives) and a side of meatballs.  We get back home and there's olives all over the salad(My boyfriend is allergic).  We call and they're unapologetic and say that we didn't specify black or green olives.(seriously!) AND then when we went back to pick up the new salad, they were super delayed and asked where the old one was(seriously!)  Oh I'm sorry, please let me bring back your screw up to give to others(That don't like olives, lol).  SECOND time.  We call and place the order for antipasto no olives, pizza, and a SIDE of meatballs.  Guess what...there's olives in the salad and 1 meatball as the side unlike the time before where there was three!  Not sure why they asked what dressing because nothing came with it.  I'd checked the salad considering  my prior experience and alerted the staff of the olive situation.  The staff was unapologetic, unfriendly and unprofessional.  I most likely won't go back.  My current impression is that it's the type of place where my food would get spit on after this review.  I really do hate being a hater on a place but I can't even give this a third shot.  Sadly this is one of the most convenient places to walk to in my neighborhood, the food is good but now it's not even an option.

48h16jyp_w8_MDp4h5sVjA.text: The food and customer service are both FANTASTIC!  This was my first time ordering from here and I ordered pizza and wings for delivery.  I accidentally ordered the wrong pizza, not realizing the White doesn't have a ton of cheese and when I called to ask for a new one, they delivered a new one quickly and Steve (co-owner) was super friendly and wouldn't even accept a delivery tip. They went above and beyond to make the new pizza with extra cheese and it was absolutely delicious! So were the wings and the white pizza (just doesn't have as much cheese as a traditional pizza).  We are definitely coming back here!

yCySnXeJ4Cq_9CRFXWvoaQ.text: Having grown up in Buffalo, I am always suspect of restaurants that claim to serve "Buffalo style" pizza. I brought my 12 year old daughter along for the 35 minute drive down from Cornelius. We were surprised by the "newness" of the facility. I was expecting a typical pizza joint. It was quite nice. Our waitress was helpful and very pleasant. After telling her about my Buffalo roots, one of the owners stopped by to talk about our hometown. Ultimately, I ordered the small pepperoni pie and a Loganberry, and my daughter ordered mozzarella sticks.   When the food arrived, I immediately noticed that the pepperoni were cooked perfectly. The edges curling up and a a nice burnt edge along the outside. In the words of my daughter, "This is how pepperoni is supposed to taste!"  Then the best part... the pizza tasted like I was in Buffalo. The sauce was tangy and the crust tasty. The pepperoni was the way I remember it as a kid. I was really happy that I had finally found the holy grail of pizza in Charlotte. I will now be a regular.

fxacTkCoxx6rrehmdpkKKw.text: Wonderful food and the service is excellent! Love it!! The Wings!!! Double fried and dipped!

DQN50D4YPbJ7b6U5Iy41ZA.text: They have really good food but the hours in which the business is open are very confusing and the employees are a bit slow.

2qQnaKwL3UXiebS-oYThGA.text: Holy cow are you kidding me? The pizza is great here but the wings? Off. The. Chart. Some if the very best pizza and wings I have ever had. Worth the trip into to Uptown, you won't be disappointed.

DHgMknfv861wl__ovYej_w.text: As a Western NY native and third ward resident, I was very excited to see that a WNY style pizza joint opening just a two block walk from my home. I had actually not realized it had already opened when I was walking to grab some lunch today.   I walked up to the bar and was greeted immediately by the friendly bartender and the owner was present as well. As I was in a hurry, I just ordered two slices of pepperoni to go. But, while I was waiting, I did take in the Buffalo decor (signed Andre Reed jersey was a great touch) and the fact that a delivery man was hauling in some labatt blue. What a great reminder of home! The slices came out quickly and I assured them that if the slices proved delicious, I would be a regular.   Once I opened the box, the pizza did not disappoint. Nice fluffy and soft dough, great sauce, no lack of cheese and a nice, crisp crust. I am having several friends down from WNY this summer and I will be taking them all to Bisonte to get their thoughts!  I sincerely look forward to many evenings where I'll be able to eat there and wash it down with a nice cold blue light!

Iw2mSu5h2fGDMymDZwvOLw.text: Ok first -- I am not from Buffalo NY.  But wow. These guys have it figured out. This is an adult pizza joint.  Well "engineered" 'za.   The crust is crispy AND chewy.  The sauce is savory. The toppings--fantastic, fresh. flavorful.   Try the Bisonte Classic.  22 minutes in the 500-degree oven turns this pile of fresh ingredients into a magnificent blend of meaty peppery cheesy goodness.   You've been warned!!

WpZYNyX6BWMKD4JiamhHNQ.text: Boneless wings and fries are awesome. An added bonus is you can get pizza by the slice with two extra toppings at no extra charge. Dave the bar tender makes a great Long Island.

G3lxEj9tuyZFaH5x3LbtvQ.text: Decent pizza and wings.  Ordered a veggie pizza (buffalo style) and hot wings.  The pizza was great but the wings were just okay (we should have tried the specialty ones vs. just hot).  Service was decent which was pleasantly surprising since we went on opening day.  Will be back to try their sandwiches and other wing flavors.

photos.caption: Photo of Bisonte Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Bisonte Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Bisonte Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States

IoVy23E_T-8KKkzMi_G0vg.text: Amazing food, and even better customer service. The owners of Bisonte not only cook amazing food, but go the extra mile for the customer to have an enjoyable dining experience. Highly recommend all items on the menu, and add some sesame seeds to your pizza crust!

n5cN0isrQReZ1fO7iKIMDA.text: I enjoyed my chicken parm. And spaghetti lunch.  The waiter was a little confused about what came with it (spaghetti and an awesome garlic stick) but no big deal.  I did have to wait longer than others for my meal to arrive.  So it may not be the best place for people with light item time for lunch.

KzuFlFmRs05zYgS8WKA7UA.text: Bisonte classic was really good. Best pizza in Charlotte!  Perfect pizza.  Great atmosphere and attentive service even a busy game day. We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Bisonte Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States

t8f3xYsS2bvN_VMf1jp_tA.text: Such a treat! I've never had buffalo style pizza before but I like it! The restaurant is decorated very nice and the air conditioning is nice and cool on a hot day. It's a little off he beaten path of what I consider uptown, more on the way to midtown. However, it tastes amazing. The pizza roll ups were good but I probably wouldn't get them again. The slices were delicious. The philly cheese steak was by far my favorite. Also the fries are hand cut and taste so fresh!

twLi56a2UhpxFFC7IdouIw.text: Honestly. One of the worst pizzas I've ever had. No redeeming qualities whatsoever. Sauce is bland. Too much cheese. Bad crust. Not crispy enough. Just not good. 3.3/10.

uCCkAMj8DopuCni73rPgdA.text: We love Bisonte (Italian for Buffalo) pizza!  Great , great Buffalo style pizza! Thick crust, but not too thick) crust. He brings ingredients from Buffalo! Give it a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Bisonte Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States

gg3joPRSMMgavjDXtcA2tQ.text: Not to ruin their 4 star rating but it's just ok. Nice to have in the area but the sauce didn't stand out on the pizza, meatball sub nor wings.    I like wet wings. These are nicely covered but we only got hot.   I look foreword to trying the Antipasti + grilled wings.   Dining is an option. You'll be seated. Full bar.   1 cheese slice $3 12 wings $12.99 1 meatball sub $7.99  They toasted the bun.  Wings come with the star of the evening: in house homemade Blue cheese and Ranch. You get 2 when you order 12 wings so I was cool.   $54.99 family deal. It's worth it because of the wings. My family wouldn't be give such, though.   Oh. They tape the to go boxes    I have yet to receive anything from the email club.   Open until midnight.  Summation: nothing stood out except the dressings. The sauce was bland on the pizza and meatballs.   $24.88 for the three things ordered above.

2grEnErDC50-GCmTP4e2mw.text: Take out orders will more than likely be wrong which happens just about every time. I ordered a veggie bomber with regular cheese, add lettuce, tomatoes, hot peppers, light mayo and extra bomber sauce. Instead, when I opened my sandwich is was a sub with a tablespoon of onions, mushrooms, and bell peppers. Unless I'm sitting at the bar and the bartender is Nina or Randy, I can guarantee that I will wish that I would have called Jersey Mike's instead.

photos.caption: Photo of Bisonte Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States

g-RSvocgAmQ4Yvu3dFbLaQ.text: I was on the hunt for some wings and pizza and saw on Yelp this place carried things found in Buffalo NY.  The wings are some of the best I've had in Charlotte thus far. They weren't soggy and had a little crisp to them. Sauce was flavorful. The blue cheese is amazing - lots of fresh blue cheese chunks.  The pepperoni pizza was great! The pepperoni curls up with a little bit of grease inside. In my opinion, the best way to eat pepperoni on a pizza. As a cold pizza lover, I liked the pizza better the next day than hot.   If you like beef on weck, I still think Lebowskis has the best but it's not bad here.   I will be ordering this again! Next time, I want to try one of their speciality crusts like the garlic. It's not an additional cost which is awesome!

PLmbsr3VyVw9_t6--e5HFg.text: Good place for pizza that reminds me of home! Despite them never being able to find the entrance to my apartment building I will keep ordering from here because it's so good!!! Go Buffalo!

_drXbHpuAkQsAwizZpZ2Hw.text: The wings here are so delicious.. too be honest one of my favorite in Charlotte. It's kind of hard getting over there now due to all this crazy construction going on in front, but it's definitely worth the headache. I have yet to try the pizza from here but it looks pretty good.

bk2XURteVcZcMbf86RC73g.text: The wings and pizza was amazing. Coming from Buffalo - we are an authority on great pizza and wings. The owner was fantastic who spent a few minutes with us. Anna our waitress did an awesome job ! Will be back again !

XDC7uC-8m9JYabnsXUBlWw.text: I ordered takeout from Bisonte Pizza. I am from Buffalo originally and miss the pizza places back home. The sub I ordered was great! Could have used more veggies, but still good. I also got a cookie and I came warm! I'd definitely order takeout again, but this time I'm trying their pizza.

gEiN8gIQtJKXCNkwn5Yezw.text: Ordered several things via DoorDash and was quite disappointed with the food.  First off, the breaded/fried mozzarella was overcooked, overly-salted, bland, and the accompanying tasteless marinara dipping sauce is forgetful.  The very chewy wings, again overly-salted, appeared to be made from starving chickens considering the lack of meat on the bone. Yet, I have to say that the ranch dressing was very good.  Lastly, the salad with chicken was very good but I wish I ordered it with field greens instead of iceberg... The blue cheese was good.  Because the food was delivered I've no opinion on ambiance but their food needs work.

57yAJ5PJIJ_i-8I9CD7lgw.text: The employees are extremely rude and it comes down from management. They just want your money. My friend wasn't satisfied with her food and they refused to give her a refund. Told me if I'm going to order a drink then they will "definitely need to see ID" like yes, that's how it works? Most of their food sucks anyways, their pizza is good but that's it. Food isn't good enough to be losing people over customer service and rude employees. See it shutting down soon

LKHaAsms9pI7v-jCsteTEw.text: Yum! I've been to the Matthews location and was super surprised at how different this location compares. You have a hostess and a server at this location. I love the decor. The staff is friendly too! We got a couple slices of pizza and the buffalo hot wings. The hot wings were piping hot and it paired well with the ranch. The slices are so good. We got cheese and pepperoni. It's fluffy and airy and not crunchy which I love. I would definitely come back to this place. It's just so good!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bisonte Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hot wings
Photo of Bisonte Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pep slices
Photo of Bisonte Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States

M05v9QihiWiT0VnrRi-Vdg.text: Fantastic food, casual atmosphere... we all got standard Italian items; pizza, meatballs, wings, salads with house made dressing, everything was wonderful, great friendly service, we'll be back.

6Yx8Mzkx0tHs1synKsn7IA.text: Still my favorite place to eat. Food here brings Buffalo to me. Best part is I tell people if they want good Buffalo food, come to Charlotte and come here

ZC_Cq9q4YuSLC5Mb2bGqsQ.text: The food is absolutely amazing!  Plenty of options to satisfy everyone's appetite.  Biggest issue is they closed down delivery an hour early and we had to walk to pick our food up.  Well worth the walk, but for the price and their advertising- they really need to deliver the full night!

tJ9P8ys46QypuzfEZxXCDA.text: Big fan of this Buffalo style Pizza, Wings and Sub joint! They hit the trifecta for me and my friend! We split a dozen wings (try the carolina style sauce), The Stinger (Philly cheese steak with a buffalo flavored chicken tender inside) and a Buffalo style Pepperoni pizza.    The pizza blew me away the most.  IMO there isn't a lot of great pizza in uptown Charlotte.  This is some of the best i've had in the city.  A lot of space.  Located on S trade near J&W university.  Great beer specials on Thursdays.

photos.caption: Photo of Bisonte Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wings. Regular BBQ and Carolina style mix.
Photo of Bisonte Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Stinger! Philly with buffalo tender inside
Photo of Bisonte Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. Buffalo style Pepperoni pizza

bLwVbrXN0N7tRIFqDTdI4g.text: I was sadly disappointed with my first experience here. The fiance and I came around 7pm on a weeknight and it wasn't crowded and there was plenty of seating (it's actually a huge space!). We ordered pretty quickly after being seated, but it took at least 30 minutes if not 45 for us to get our food. The wait seemed extraordinarily long considering we had ordered two personal pizzas off the main menu. Everyone around us experienced a similar wait. And no one came by to say, "sorry for the wait" or offer an explanation or anything. I wish I could give them the benefit of the doubt and chalk it up to being a new place, but they have another thriving location and this location had been open a few weeks already by the time we went.  The pizza was cheesy, but overall so-so. The Buffalo-style crust is a thicker type crust, somewhere between NY and Chicago, so that it can hold the weight of all the toppings and cheese. The slices are still flimsy though and don't have that crunchy crust that I like. There were also very few vegetarian options on the menu. I wound up ordering the Veggie Lovers and subbing spinach fir the black olives (I'm not an olive person). The toppings were fine, but nothing with a ton of flavor or texture. I just felt like there wasn't much to this to help it stand out.

BEKmTHPBZL9JC_D8eFOMQg.text: This is absolutely the best pizza in Charlotte. We are from Buffalo,we know how  pizza should taste .Every time we go there they make us feel like family , even know us by name. We love the way the pepperoni curls up into a little bowl , like no other you'll find anywhere  in Charlotte. Stop in and see the smiiling faces of Jim and Steve the brothers who know how to make pizza and love  doing It!!!

n-UJkr4mfTfbOVSjxjiz2w.text: I would like to think I've tried a wide variety of pizza places in Charlotte....bisonte pizza is definitely my favorite!! I'm from New Jersey and have lived in upstate New York, so I'm supposed to know what qualifies as "good" pizza, right?!   You have the option of choosing from buffalo or NY style and specialty crusts. The Buffalo is ever so slightly thicker than the NY and my go-to style, as well as the butter or Parmesan crust. I have tried the cheese and pepperoni pizza. I'm not usually a big fan of pepperoni, but these pepperonis are smaller than your typical topping and seem to be baked prior to being added to your pizza. I love the crispy aspect that they add!  My boyfriend tried their boneless wings which came with a side of fries. Maybe that's a Buffalo thing?   I'm very happy that this place opened uptown and wish them nothing but success! I just realized that you can sign up for email deals. It would be great if they linked up with Yelp for cash back when you dine there. Also, I would suggest that they send out a coupon to residents in the immediate area to increase local 4th ward support.

P7nAmRqV8cuesaElwRtNzQ.text: A tad pricey but very good. I paid $34 for 1 topping pizza and wings. Everything was really good though. I got the Carolina Gold wings and loved them.

B9WIdTV-AzeC3-ezmpn5IQ.text: Bisonte has slowly became our go-to pizza place! I really don't know how to explain the pizza, but it's amazing! I'm usually a veggie toppers kinda girl, but here you have to go with the OG - buffalo style pizza with cheese and pepperonis. The pepperonis aka grease cups are so GOOD! And the pizza is always loaded with cheese! I'm sure that's why I love it so much. If you're watching what you eat- stay away!!!   The sizes are also great - my husband and I started splitting a small and we always have left overs- plus we get the wings! They are also equally as good and cooked to perfection.   Also if you're looking for something different, most, if not all of their appetizers come with fries (even the moz sticks!)! I'm not going to lie- we've gotten pizza, wings, chicken tenders and fries before (all one order) - you know, we gotta be fat kids for life! Add a side of ranch and you got a great "date" night at home - plus a food coma that's SO worth it.

Ti317OsE6PWKRlZRrKXB6g.text: Great Pizza... I am grateful to find good pizza 10 minutes from home. I have a friend from Western New York and she posted Bistonte on my FB,  the pie looked amazing and told her I would be happy to have good pie in Indian Trail.    I ordered a large pie, it was pricey at $25.42 for a three topping pie. The toppings were fresh, the pie tasty and the crust amazing.    I would highly recommend (thanks Melayne!!)

j8aWM3TI_ZUHo_caIL7nEA.text: Bistone has quickly become one of, if not the top, favorite pizza places in Charlotte. Don't you dare ordering anything but the Buffalo Style pizza (they've got NY style, but don't even think about it). Buffalo style is just that good. LOADED with cheese. I'm usually a big proponent of 'specialty' pizzas like Hawaiian, all meat, supreme etc. BUT -- the regular buffalo style pizza with just cheese & pepperoni is my go-to here. The bring in actual buffalo peps, which my wife lovingly calls "grease cups". These mini-peps actually curl up and crisp in the oven during baking, so they look like little cups of heaven.  Their wings are also nothing to snub your nose at. Plenty of sauces to pick from compliment these large, meaty wings that are expertly cooked. Pizza is always ready quickly, usually in about 15-20 minutes tops.  The downfall of Bisonte, currently, is all the construction surrounding it. Parking is a PITA due to the street being closed, so my wife and I always order it either take-out (illegally park down at the corner by the Subway) or delivery.

G4lfsWHPG7CED4c0i1Ni4Q.text: We came here on a Sunday night after me googling best chicken wings in Charlotte. Lol. We ordered a veggie pizza and subbed the olives with jalapenos, honey bbq wings, buffalo wings, and fries. The inside was very clean. There is a bar area that is well stocked and a visible sign with drink specials. All of the employees were very friendly and helpful. NOW THE FOOD-it was delicious. No complaints at all. Well I had to get extra sauce for my wings, but that doesn't count lol. The wings were crisp and flavorful, and the pizza was scrumptious! I literally have no complaint about anything here! While everything was delicious, it's pretty weird that my favorite was their blue cheese! It's homemade and it was the best blue cheese of my life!   Parking is a little weird with all of the construction, but it's worth the walk!

photos.caption: Photo of Bisonte Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. Veggie pizza with onions, green peppers, mushrooms, and jalapeños.
Photo of Bisonte Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fries
Photo of Bisonte Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. Honey bbq and buffalo wings with blue cheese and an extra side of buffalo sauce

W5a5vyP0Zhs-x0Zt1VTWbg.text: I had heard good things about the wings here and had the chance to try them at the Yelp wing fling last year. They were really good, so I knew I needed to try them for real.   We were at Blue Blaze this weekend and Bisonte is conveniently close so a few of us got delivery. It took a little less than an hour on a Friday night for it to arrive which was what they estimated.   Everyone else was in the mood for pizza, but we decided to get both pizza and wings. We got a large buffalo chicken finger pizza and 12 wings -- half sweet chili and half Carolina gold.   Everything was delicious. The pizza was probably my favorite non-Italian style in Charlotte. They have flavored crust too and we got garlic. The wings were probably my second favorite in Charlotte (I love Seoul Food & Meat Co). They grill them and they are a little crispy for the perfect texture. Both sauces we got were delicious.   The large pizza is huge, a small definitely would have been enough for us. I think one person would probably still have leftovers with a small.   I'd highly recommend checking this place out for some great wings and pizza!

photos.caption: Photo of Bisonte Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. Three cheese steak pizza
Photo of Bisonte Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sweet chili and Carolina gold wings
Photo of Bisonte Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. Large buffalo chicken finger pizza

2PvLcyEWEm1JMUnN1W8Wnw.text: Been searching for some good pizza and it's finally been discovered. Bisonte Pizza Co. Wow. I came here after eating a large meal and wasn't even feeling hungry so I knew the pizza was that GREAT and it wasn't my hunger pangs tricking me out. This pepperoni pizza was pure perfection, I had to get another slice before I walked out. It's the right combination of the special dough recipe, the cheese, and the pizza sauce. I also love how they don't overly mass top their pizzas with pepperoni. Not a fan of extra salty/greasy overloaded pepperoni pizzas. I'm sure you could request to place more toppings if that's your fancy, but the dough is what you need to experience here at Bisonte and they surely make it stand out for you with minimal pepperoni pieces. Crispy bite-size pepperoni will have any pizza fan in gratification. Bisonte means buffalo in Italian and this restaurant was opened by two brothers who grew up in Buffalo, NY. Their wings are super big time as well, but if you want to know where to grab some awesome pizza, Bisonte is the place.

photos.caption: Photo of Bisonte Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. Half Pepperoni Half Hawaiian. Cherries are an awesome addition.
Photo of Bisonte Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tomato Basil.
Photo of Bisonte Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pepperoni Pizza.

Nb6XYKRwa7-Vu66o3NheEA.text: I haven't made it to the location yet, but I ordered from Uber Eats and the food was so good I'm already planning my next visit.   We ordered the meat lovers pizza and sweet bbq wings. The pizza was delicious! It had just the right ratio of sauce to cheese and toppings. Every bite had just the right amount of cheesy goodness. I highly recommend.   The wings were good too! They were all a good size and bbq was just the right about if sweet and savory.   You guys....They made all the dressings from scratch. I tried the ranch and I could have put it in a cup and drank it. It was so good. I dipped my pizza and the wings. Do yourself a favor and get a dressing on the side.   Everything was good! I am looking forward to an official visit so I can give more times a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Bisonte Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wings
Photo of Bisonte Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pizza

bAY5YuL5KZKWm0Ek7o_hag.text: So, I'm not from buffalo nor do I know what their pizza style is, but I do know this spot churns out some good food!  They offer pizza, wings, and sandwiches as well as a full bar and some TVs to catch any games you might want.   My husband went for their NY style pizza with pepperoni. I will say, the "buffalo style" pepperoni are small little cups, which is different, but still just as tasty. Bisonte also allows you to get flavored crust. We always get the garlic and it's delicious. They have other options as well. The pizza itself is good, with the dough a little bit more on the chewy side. I usually go for their wings, and the medium is the perfect spice level for me. I do wish they came with celery or carrots, but the wings themselves are meaty and cooked perfectly. They also have homemade bleu cheese, which is delicious!   There is one downside (but it's not their fault). Right now they're not the easiest to access because of the construction on trade. As long as your ok with a little walk, you'll be fine. Bisonte also delivers within a certain area of Charlotte, so it pays to call and ask before assuming they will deliver to you.

photos.caption: Photo of Bisonte Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. NY style with pepperoni
Photo of Bisonte Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hand cut fries!
Photo of Bisonte Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States

HeJP5b0f0k9DDf83kC3iMw.text: We just got to Charlotte for the night before we head back to our home in Houston and we were craving pizza! I didn't want the commercial pizza places so my husband who frequents Charlotte for work suggested Bisonte Pizza. We ordered the large cheese pizza with the chef salad with ranch. The gentleman on the phone was so pleasant and wanted to make sure we were informed on what to order. He estimated a 45minute delivery but, it arrived to our hotel in about 30 minutes. The 8 slice large pizza was HUGE and enough for the four of us. The chef salad was great and the homemade ranch was perfection. I highly recommend anyone craving pizza in the Charlotte area to order from here!

5E9r4zWzB7p59vqqjaLylQ.text: The homemade bleu cheese- WORTH EVERY DAMN CALORIE. So good.   I've always been a big fan of their Matthews location and am so happy there is finally one much closer to me. This one is in Gateway Village. Skip the parking deck and grab a spot on the street (all full? Make sure to look across the street at the inbound side as well).  Bisonte means buffalo in Italian. There are two styles of pizza crust here: Buffalo (a little thicker) and New York. You can also get free specialty crusts (sesame, cajun, onion, butter, garlic, parmesan). They also do pizza by the slice. My favorite pie here is the Bisonte Classic (pepperoni, mushrooms, onions, hot peppers, black olives, Italian sausage, capicola). Such a great combination of toppings. I also love their Steak Bomber (like a philly). The wings are delicious, my friends love the Stinger (steak and chicken fingers sub).   Specials:  MONDAY: $1.00 off any 12" sub TUESDAY: $3.50 off a large cheese +1 topping pizza WEDNESDAY: $1.00 off any order of pasta  This location is way different than the Matthews one. It's huge. Full bar available. If you're a Bills fan, you'll love this spot.

64QwiGtikYXjVR5dun7K8w.text: I love Bisonte !! I always order buffalo style pizza and hot bbq wings from the pit and it's always delicious. Remind me of our pizza and wings from home ( Buffalo, NY ). They also sale Loganberry and if you know what that is and you love it then you're in luck because it's hard to find down south.   The employees are always cheerful and the service is pretty fast.

ZIc2ZNLrn0KZcStvmhQ6kw.text: Food is great I ordered food for pick up and to my surprise there was no parking on trade st (which I wasn't made aware of)so I had to drive in circles to find parking spot on side st..then get all the way home and I got 22 wings instead of 25 smh !! Just chk ya food b4 you leave

zKqE4hbgeKpkFSxlnI08wg.text: Pizza was too greasy and did not taste good at all. Ordered a white pizza and it had onions and Parmesan on it? No mozzarella and ricotta. Very confusing?   I'd suggest updating how you make white pizza. Most people think white pizza is crust with oil instead of sauce and then mozzarella and fresh ricotta and garlic.

WBWT6hJ3PBO9UYqARZ-ULA.text: Not bad at all, but not awesome or even great. Relatively small place, fairly quiet the late Wednesday night I was there. Staffing was minimal which might explain why how dirty the place was when I walked in. Most tables were vacant but unusable because they were not cleaned up in a timely manner. I might have walked out, but I was hungry and was a bit tired from a long day at work. My hotel was close by, so I settled in. Ordered the small size, NY style type pepperoni. Tasty, but not exactly NY. Good non-the-less. Overall, I gave it a 3 star, it could have been much better, but it could have been much worse as well. I was just happy that they were open late, even with their major front street all torn up.  You won't be disappointed, especially when you are tired and hungry.

SUplDvA-8dXkY21vsrwAOA.text: My son and I went in here on a Saturday around noon. I read about the place on Big Time Bites blog. As a Bills fan, that was just a big time plus.  Although I am not from Buffalo (or Western NY), I have spent a lot of time there on business.  I became a Bills fans after Jerry Butler (Clemson) sort of befriended me (long story) when I helped my dad at his ice cream store in Clemson on weekends as a young kid.  Anyway... Bisonte....  I have eaten at all the "hot spots" in the Buffalo area and I can tell you the wings here are L-E-G-I-T.  Crisp on the outside and hot, steamy and flavorful on the inside.  Good size too.    Pizza - we got it "Buffalo Style"... a little thicker crust.  We will get it "New York Style" next time to compare.  We got pepperoni and they use those nickel sized pepperonis that cup up when you cook them.  Fantastic.  Fries - I saw that had fresh cut and I am a real sucker for those.  They were excellent.  Blue Cheese - had to edit my review as I forgot to mention the Blue Cheese.  Oh My God... the Blue Cheese.  Homemade and out of this world good.  We didn't get celery with our wings.  I wonder of they don't offer celery???  Beef On Weck - We did not get (see heart attack waiting to happen meal choices above).  But, this is a western NY specialty and I look forward to giving it a try next trip.  Anyone know if they are a "Bills Bar" on NFL Sundays?  Service - excellent.  She was very friendly and attentive.    HIGHLY RECOMMEND this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Bisonte Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. Buffalo Style Pepperoni Pizza and Hot Wings

7y2c1gqcFaFMN7WYoSkV2A.text: Really great place and love the owners. The wings are True buffalo wings with great housemade blue cheese. Pizza is also really good and priced right by the slice. Would recommend for sure.

sUMvevKKwkr9ORPn-6NJNg.text: TLDR: The food is delectable, savory, and crisp. The vibe is casual. The service is adequate. Considering all American style pizzas I've had in Charlotte, Bisonte Pizza has my favorite. Considering all traditional wings I've had in Charlotte, Bisonte Pizza also has my favorite. Between their pizza and their wings, I think the wings have it. Consider Bisonte Pizza for a lazy Friday dinner.

ndtPErDbP5Vpspt8kR6nxA.text: I'm gonna start by sharing that I have high expectations for pizza and Bisonte Pizza did a great job!   We came in as a group of seven and enjoyed a large pepperoni pizza, two orders of fresh cute fries and a "triple" order of wings with honey mustard and bourbon BBQ.   The wings stood out to me. They were cooked perfectly with a bit of a sear on them and the sauce was evenly coated. The blue cheese is made in-house and is quite tasty (I normally don't touch blue cheese but always agree to try if it is homemade!). The ranch was also a nice accompaniment to the wings and I definitely preferred the BBQ style.   The cheese on the pizza was ooey-gooey melted perfection, I just wish it came out well-done as ordered. The pepperoni could've been more abundant as well. The crust however was chewy and delicious but not too thick. I'd definitely order again!  The fries were fresh cut and steaming hot. A little too greasy for my preference and could've been seasoned more.    I'm removing a star for the flaws in execution mentioned above. It's nice to have some decent pizza outside of the NY/NJ area!

photos.caption: Photo of Bisonte Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Bisonte Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Bisonte Pizza - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bourbon BBQ WINGS

MX5BwNh-bE77oTtc91TXuA.text: You have pizza and wings?  Can we be best friends forever?  Bisonte Pizza, I apologize, you were not in my radar until recently, but considering I do not venture into the gateway area of Uptown as much... it's totally my fault.  Came here after a fun evening with a large group.  We just needed food in our bellies to soak up all the champagne and wine we had be partaking and pizza sounded like a great means to an end.  It was a weeknight (Thursday)... so not very busy... we sat at the long communal table, however this place has plenty of other tables and even another section (maybe to rent out for parties?).  TVs lined the walls so a good sports watching venue as well.  Server was super nice and patient as we were a large group and she was super accommodating.  We ended up splitting pizza and wings between the 7 of us and it hit the spot.  Their wings were especially notable cause of the char on the tips and then the glaze was just the right amount.. not too soggy and not too dry.  The pizza was solidI will have to come back  Probably the one ding is that the parking deck... we may have not gotten the memo on validation or anything, but it seemed like a pain - maybe because we lost our ticket and we ended up paying the max $14 for the day parking.  I believe this is plenty of street parking... probably metered, but my mind was clearly on the food for the evening so I think that's the only ding I would give them with this location, but everything else was excellent.

dI9etUQSbXKUhzZkU3fewA.text: This is hands down thee best pizza, wings, and steak bomber place this side of the Mississippi!! Even with the construction that makes it difficult to get there I still find myself making it there. Always great food, and great service!!!

yQvVDJPrP5ysMJoXppqV0A.text: Went for the first time last night to the Charlotte location.  I've been looking forward to it opening for a while and was not disappointed.  We got pizza and wings and good service as well.  So happy to finally have good Buffalo pizza nearby.

dGQbb7mynGafVpLqbbzt6g.text: Good pizza, but was slow getting to the table. That might be because of it only being open a few days. The place is super loud and makes it hard to have a conversation without screaming. Also a few hiccups on table condiment and missing marinara with my friends cheese sticks..   Prices are from reasonable to ouch!!! Depending on what you are getting.
